text: This story took place a long time ago, during a beautiful summer
When everything was green and the sun was shining proudly over the plains and the forests
At the edge of a puddle, hidden from the eyes of the animals of prey
A duck had made its nest and was brooding her eggs
Before the chicks were hatched, the duck was really bored because no one would come to visit her
Her friends preferred to splash around in the water instead of keeping her company
And then, the time came for the ducklings to see the light of day
First, one egg cracked open, and then another one, and then another one
Until all of them had cracked with the exception of one
This egg seemed to be bigger and stranger than the rest of the eggs
...could be heard from all directions
The ducklings came to life and took their first steps
...said the mother duck
And then all the ducklings started repeating after her, every word the best they could
Looking all around them and being amazed at how big the world was
But the mother duck was very worried about the egg that still had not hatched
What is wrong with this egg?
Maybe it’s not its time yet?
After a little while, the big egg finally began to crack
...said the chick coming out of the shell
She was a strange duckling, smokey grey
With ruffled feathers and a longer neck than the rest of the ducklings
The mother duck looked her over carefully and she said:
Oh my! You’re so big!
You don’t look like your siblings
Maybe you belong to a chicken or a turkey!
Let’s put you in the water and see if you're able to swim
And that’s what she did!
The mother duck took her offspring and started towards the nearby lake
Once they got there, she gave the order:
...and one by one, the ducklings jumped in the water
At first, the water was too deep for them
They managed to rise quickly to the surface and swim with much ease, even the ugly grey chick
She can’t be a chicken
Not even a turkey
Look how well she moves her feet and how well she floats on the water
She must be mine
And if you look closely at her, she’s even quite cute
The ducklings played in the water until they were tired
And then the mother duck called them back:
Follow me to the duck yard
But stay close to me, so you don’t get stepped on, and look out for cats
The ducklings formed a straight line behind their mother and they all set out toward the duck yard
When they spotted them, the ducks in the yard gave them a long look and said aloud:
Look at who we have here!
We’re already too many here!
Look how ugly that one is!
Unbelievable, she’s so unusual!
One of the ducks dashed toward the ugly duckling and pinched the back of her head
Leave her alone! What did she do to you?
She didn’t do anything to me, but she’s too big and very strange; we have to do something about this
Please, just leave her alone
It’s true that perhaps she’s not the prettiest duckling, but she is good-natured
And she can swim as well as the others, maybe even better
The mother duck caressed the duckling and smoothed down her feathers
When she gets older, she’ll surely be more beautiful
And that’s how the mother duck and the ducklings decided to stay here and make it their home
But the other ducks continued to be mean with the ugly duckling:
they pinched her, pushed her, and made fun of her; and not just the ducks, but the chickens as well
The poor duckling didn’t know where to hide and what to do
She was so upset because she was so ugly and all the birds in the yard made fun of her
One day, the ugly duckling couldn’t stand it anymore and she jumped over the fence
She set out in the big wide world, telling herself:
If nobody loves me here, I will go somewhere else then, some place where I will be received with open arms
She walked for a while until she reached the big pond, where the wild ducks were spending their time
The ugly duckling went to them and said hello as nicely as she could
When they saw her, the wild ducks gave her a long look and then asked her:
Tell me, what kind of bird are you?
You’re very ugly
But we don’t care; you can stay with us
The poor duckling was happy she could sit in the reeds and drink a little water
She stayed there for two days, in the peace and quiet, until the hunters came
Bang-bang!
All the birds in the surrounding area were frightened and the ones who could fly away did so
The hunting dogs went into the reeds looking for the birds
and one of them – a dog with long ears and a wet nose - came close to the ugly duckling
gave her a puzzled look, sniffed her, and moved on
I am such an ugly duckling that not even the dog wants to bite me or have much to do with me
I was lucky they didn't get me this time!
The poor duckling hid even deeper in the reeds and waited for a few more hours until the hunters left
Then, she got out of the pond and ran as fast as she could, crossing the field and hiding in the forest
Autumn came
And the leaves turned yellow and dry
The wind ripped them from the branches and scattered them in the air
It was cold
The poor duckling was trembling, huddled near the forest lake
One evening, a flock of big and beautiful birds suddenly appeared
The duckling had never seen birds as beautiful as them in her whole life
They were as white as snow and had long and delicate necks
They were...swans
They stopped for a little while, and then they spread wide their great wings and continued their voyage to warmer climates
The ugly duckling was overcome by a strange restlessness
She couldn’t sit still anymore
Wow i wonder who are those wonderful birds?
She didn’t know their name, she didn’t know where they had gone
But she felt more drawn to them than to anyone else she knew
The poor ugly duckling would have been very happy if at least the ducks had welcomed her to their flock and hadn’t sent her away
Winter came
The duckling had to swim all the time and move from one place to another
So that she wouldn’t freeze completely
But after a while, she became tired and went to find a warmer spot
A storm started and the duckling reached a small house at the edge of a village
She hid behind the house and waited for the wind to stop
All of a sudden, the duckling noticed that the door of the house was half-open
And so she went inside to escape the wind
In the house, there were an old woman, a tomcat, and a chicken
The old woman kept the tomcat in the house because he caught mice
And the chicken because she laid eggs
The old woman noticed the duckling and asked her:
Who are you?
You seem to be a duck
I’m so happy!
Now I’ll also have some duck eggs
But a long time had passed, and the duckling hadn’t laid any eggs
The tomcat and the chicken started to make fun of her:
Can you lay eggs?
No, I can’t
Then I won’t bother speaking to you
Because I am the most important one here
And the tomcat asked the duckling:
Can you cuddle, purr, can you catch mice?
No, unfortunately I can’t
Then what are you good for duck?
And so, the duckling would spend her days in a corner, not wanting to do anything
All of a sudden, she remembered the fresh outside air and the sunlight
She started missing the water and she had the urge to swim
She couldn’t bear it any longer, so she told the chicken about it
What’s wrong with you?
Find something to do, lay eggs or purr, and you’ll see you’ll have a carefree life
But it’s so nice to float on the water
What kind of activity is that?
It’s the first time I heard of such a thing
You don’t understand me!
What’s there to understand?
Be happy that you’re in a warm place and that you don’t have to go outside in the storm
Learn to do what is asked of you:
lay some eggs or go catch mice, and you’ll have a great life
But the ugly duckling had already made up her mind:
Well I think that I’ll go into the big wide world
Suit yourself
And so the duckling left
Lucky for her, winter was short and spring soon started
There were flowers everywhere, and all of a sudden the duckling saw that she could spread her wings wide
And that her wings were much stronger than before
She flew off and she soon reached a lake
There were apple trees in bloom and perfumed lilac bushes that were growing next to the lake
How beautiful everything was!
Three swans came out from the reeds, floating gently on the surface of the water
The ugly duckling saw them and said to herself:
I will get close to those beautiful birds
But I think they will ignore me
Because I am ugly
But I won’t know unless I try
Maybe they’ll be nice to me and accept me for who I am
The ugly duckling gathered her courage and flew toward the swans
When they saw her, they started flapping their wings frantically, moving toward her as well
The duckling landed on the shore of the lake, thinking that the swans didn’t like her
You don’t accept me either
...said the poor duckling lowering her head in sadness
But when she looked in the water, surprise!
She saw a reflection of herself, but now she wasn’t ugly anymore
She had turned into a very beautiful white bird
She was...a swan
The other swans landed next to her and welcomed her into their circle
We haven’t seen you around
Let’s be friends please. What do you say?
Back when I was an ugly duckling, I couldn’t have ever dreamed of such happiness before!
The ugly duckling turned into a beautiful swan
And lived together with the other swans, feeling happy and complete
Because now she felt that she was finally home
